derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English tæg(e)l, from a Germanic base meaning 'hair, hairy tail'; related to Middle Low German tagel 'twisted whip, rope's end'. The early sense of the verb (early 16th cent.) was 'fasten to the back of something'
Middle English (denoting a tallage): from Old French taille 'notch, tax', from taillier 'to cut', based on Latin talea 'twig, cutting'

encyclopedia.content: Linux命令：显示文件结尾 Head/Tail head 与 tail 就像它的名字一样的浅显易懂，它是用来显示开头或结尾某个数量的文字区块，head 用来显示档案的开头至标准输出中，而 tail 想当然就是看档案的结尾，看看下面的范例： (1)? displays the first 6 lines of a file head -6 readme.txt (2) displays the last 25 lines of a file tail -25 mail.txt 范例一是显示档案的前 6 行，范例二则是显示档案最后的 25 行。 而下面的范别，结

entry.def: The tail of an animal, bird, or fish is the part extending beyond the end of its body.

example.ex: The cattle were swinging their tails to disperse the flies.
example.tran: 那些牛甩动着尾巴驱赶苍蝇。

example.ex: ...a black dog with a long tail.

entry.def: You can use tail to refer to the end or back of something, especially something long and thin.

example.ex: ...the horizontal stabilizer bar on the plane's tail...
Elsie tugged her husband's coat tail.
example.tran: 埃尔西用力拉了拉她丈夫外套的后摆。

entry.def: If a man is wearing tails, he is wearing a formal jacket which has two long pieces hanging down at the back.
To tail someone means to follow close behind them and watch where they go and what they do.

example.ex: Officers had tailed the gang from London during a major undercover inquiry...
example.tran: 在一次重大的秘密调查行动中，警察从伦敦就盯上了那帮匪徒。

example.ex: He trusted her so little that he had her tailed.
example.tran: 他十分不信任她，所以派人跟踪她。

entry.def: A tail is someone who is paid to watch and to follow another person.

example.tran: 他看看身后——没有人跟着。

entry.def: If you toss a coin and it comes down tails, you can see the side of it that does not have a picture of a head on it.
If you say that the tail is wagging the dog, you mean that a small or unimportant part of something is becoming too important and is controlling the whole thing.

example.ex: Past TV deals have seen the tail wagging the dog. Now football clubs feel they are equal partners with TV.
example.tran: 以往和电视台的交易中，足球俱乐部就已经有过喧宾夺主的记录。现在，他们更是觉得可以和电视台平起平坐了。

entry.tran: （由于失败或羞愧）夹着尾巴，垂头丧气
entry.def: If you say that you have your tail between your legs, you are emphasizing that you feel defeated and ashamed.

example.ex: His team retreated last night with tails tucked firmly between their legs.
example.tran: 昨晚，他的队伍灰溜溜地退场了。

entry.def: If you turn tail, you turn and run away.

example.ex: I turned tail and fled in the direction of the main house.
example.tran: 我掉头就跑，朝主屋方向逃去。

means.word_mean: 1. the posterior part of the body of a vertebrate especially when elongated and extending beyond the trunk or main part of the body
2. the time of the last part of something;

sentences.sentence: "the fag end of this crisis-ridden century"

means.word_mean: 3. any projection that resembles the tail of an animal
4. the fleshy part of the human body that you sit on;

sentences.sentence: "he deserves a good kick in the butt"
"are you going to sit on your fanny and do nothing?"

means.word_mean: 5. a spy employed to follow someone and report their movements
6. (usually plural) the reverse side of a coin that does not bear the representation of a person's head
7. the rear part of an aircraft
8. the rear part of a ship
1. go after with the intent to catch;

sentences.sentence: "The policeman chased the mugger down the alley"

means.word_mean: 2. remove or shorten the tail of an animal
3. remove the stalk of fruits or berries

example.en: The security officer was even going to put a tail on the children.
example.zh: 特工人员甚至想派个盯梢的人去跟踪那些孩子。

example.en: Do you think we shoutd sit our tails until that happens?
example.zh: 你认为我们应该坐等那种事情发生吗？n hadn't tossed him out on his tail.我没有把他摔个四脚朝天。

list.explanation: [粗俗语]作爱，(作为性交对象的)女人

example.en: He is at toose ends. All he thinks of now is tail.
example.zh: 他情绪不振，成天想的就是玩女人。

example.en: Sometimes turning tail is the only sensible thing to do.
example.zh: 有时候转身逃跑是惟一切合实际的明智做法。

example.en: When the bully saw my hig brother,he turned tail and ran.
example.zh: 那欺凌弱小的家伙看见我哥哥就转身溜了。

Sentence.sentence: In America, white tailed deer are more numerous than ever before, so abundant in fact that they've become a suburban nuisance and a health hazard.
Perhaps surprisingly, it is not all good news: there is a sting in the tail of the Obama effect
Sting in the tail Ashby Plant is one of a number of psychologists who seized on Obama's candidacy to test hypotheses about the power of role models

sentences.cn: 狗摇尾巴以报答人们的爱护。
